intro: Marrubium pseudodictamnus, commonly known as false dictamnus, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is often found in Mediterranean climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a strong, aromatic scent, while its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences. Marrubium pseudodictamnus is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
